hs:item.hs:hint: The term defines an improvised barrier.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Barikada means barricade. The stress is placed on the second a when pronouncing this word.

hs:item.hs:hint: This term describes something that is imported or exported illegally.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Kontrabanda, a loan word from Russian, should be recognized by English speakers as contraband.
Komanda means command. This is a loan word from Russian.

hs:item.hs:hint: The green and brown clothing that soldiers wear.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Kamuflýaž means camouflage. When pronouncing, the last a gets the stress.

hs:item.hs:hint: This word refers to a large, organized procession.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Parad means parade. The letter d is pronounced as /t/.

hs:item.hs:hint: A cloth canopy that allows a free fall from an aircraft.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Paraşut means parachute, pronounced the same as in English.

hs:item.hs:hint: This refers to a person with military experience.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Weteran means veteran. The stress falls on the last syllable in this word.

hs:item.hs:hint: This word refers to large-caliber guns.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Artilleriýa means artillery. When pronouncing, the stress falls on the letter e.

hs:item.hs:hint: This word defines an infantry unit.
This is a place where someone or something is located.
hs:item.hs:feedback: A loan word from Russian, pozisiýa means position.

hs:item.hs:hint: This word defines a carefully planned action.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Taktikalar means tactics. The stress falls on the first a in this word.

hs:item.hs:hint: This word refers to a military installation.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Baza means base. A long stress falls on the first a in this word.

hs:item.hs:hint: This word defines the operation of an aircraft.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Awiasiýa means aviation. Because this is a loan word from Russian, the letter s is pronounced as /ts/.

hs:item.hs:hint: A group of people keeping watch over an area.
hs:item.hs:feedback: Patrul means patrol, in which the letter u gets stressed.
